March 4th, 1952
Mr* Graydon Ausmus
WUOA
University of Alabama
University, Alabama
Dear Graydon*
I have your note of February 29th concerning the NAEB
representative at the United Nations. I would be happy to appoint
Paulu, but X don't see how he can be effective from Minneapolis*
An observer is someone who Is on hand all the time, and can
devote many hours to keeping au courrant with the work of the
United Nations* Do you have any other ideas?
Tour letter concerning the Board meeting at Columbus
poses several problems which I feel you will have to solve for
yourself* I think it advisable to have the first meeting of the
Board on Wednesday afternoon or evening, and keep at least one
full day over that* Insofar as Committee meetings are concerned,
this would be up to the individual chairmen* As soon as you set
the time for the Board meeting, and let them know about It, they
will have to work out their own time schedule for Committee
meetings*
It would certainly be an ideal thing if Kellogg could
defray the cost of the meeting of the Board, but you know the
situation as well as I do* It is entirely possible and likely
that only the Executive Director's expenses will be paid. These
are matters, of course, which might be discussed at Norman*
By all means, go ahead and set up the time of the Board
meeting, and send out notices. It is not likely that I will be
in Columbus, so you've got the full load of running the show.
As soon as I get word from Bob Hudson, I'll let you
know about inviting Scott Fletcher to talk to the Board, and
possibly to appear on the luncheon program along with Paul Walker*
With best wishes.
Cordially,
Seymour N* Siegel
President
